      static void readInOntologyTTL​(org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Model model, java.lang.String ontology_file, com.google.common.eventbus.EventBus eventBus)
      Reads in a Turtle - Terse RDF Triple Language (TTL) formatted ontology file: Turtle - Terse RDF Triple Language: https://www.w3.org/TeamSubmission/turtle/ The extra lines make sure that the files are found if run under Eclipse IDE or as a runnable Java Archive file (JAR).

      This method is used to write the Turtle formatted output files that are the result of of the conversion process.

    • Method Detail

      • writeModel

        public static void writeModel​(org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Model m,
                              java.lang.String target_file,
                              com.google.common.eventbus.EventBus eventBus)
        This method is used to write the Turtle formatted output files that are the result of of the conversion process. An utility method to export an Apache Jena RDF storage content into a Turtle formatted file-
        Parameters:
        m - an Apache Jena model
        target_file - absolute path name for an output file
        eventBus - A queue to communicate between program component. Here: status messages and errors are sent to user interface If no user interface is present, adding messages to the channel does nothing.

      • readIfcOWLOntology

        public static void readIfcOWLOntology​(java.lang.String ifc_file,
                                      org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Model model)
        Reads in a Turtle formatted ontology file into a Jena RDF store
        Parameters:
        ifc_file - The absolute path of the Turtle formatted ontology file
        model - Am Apache Jene model where the ontology triples are added.

      • readInOntologyTTL

        public static void readInOntologyTTL​(org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Model model,
                                     java.lang.String ontology_file,
                                     com.google.common.eventbus.EventBus eventBus)
        Reads in a Turtle - Terse RDF Triple Language (TTL) formatted ontology file: Turtle - Terse RDF Triple Language: https://www.w3.org/TeamSubmission/turtle/ The extra lines make sure that the files are found if run under Eclipse IDE or as a runnable Java Archive file (JAR). Eclipse: https://www.eclipse.org/
        Parameters:
        model - An Apache Jena model: RDF store run on memory.
        ontology_file - An Apache Jena ontokigy model: RDF store run on memory containing an ontology engine.
        eventBus - A queue to communicate between program component. Here: status messages and errors are sent to user interface If no user interface is present, adding messages to the channel does nothing.

      • getExpressSchema

        public static java.lang.String getExpressSchema​(java.lang.String ifc_file)
        This is a direct copy from the IFCtoRDF https://github.com/pipauwel/IFCtoRDF The idea is to make sure that we are using exactly the same ontology files that the IFCtoRDF is using for the associated Abox output.
        Parameters:
        ifc_file - the absolute path (For example: c:\ifcfiles\ifc_file.ifc) for the IFC file
        Returns:
        the IFC Express chema of the IFC file.

      • copyTriples

        public static void copyTriples​(int level,
                               org.apache.jena.rdf.model.RDFNode r,
                               org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Model output_model)
        An utility method to copy of conected Abox triples unmodified from one Jena model to another. This is used to copy ifcOWL property set data as is.
        Parameters:
        level - how many steps from the start node
        r - A RDF node to start the copying
        output_model - A Jena model where the triples are copied to

      • pathQuery

        public static java.util.List<org.apache.jena.rdf.model.RDFNode> pathQuery​(org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Resource r,
                                                                          RDFStep[] path)
        A helper method to find a list of nodes that match a given RDF path pattern
        Parameters:
        r - the starting point
        path - the path pattern
        Returns:
        the list of found noded at the RDF graoh

      • getType

        public static java.util.Optional<org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Resource> getType​(org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Resource r)
        Gives the corresponding RDF ontology class type of the RDF node in the Apache Jena RDF model.
        Parameters:
        r - An RDF recource in a Apache Jena RDF store.
        Returns:
        The ontology class Resource node as an optional, that is, if exists. An empty return is given, if the triples does not exists at the graph.
